content: this legal case involves a debt dispute between two parties referred to as mm and av mm the plaintiff took out a loan in 2007 and additional loans in 2008 and 2009 due to financial difficulties a property was sold in 2017 but it did not cover the entire debt mm believes that av the defendant should be responsible for half of the loan balance and the obligation to purchase real estate during the marriage av claims that the debt is a joint obligation and that mm sold a property without their consent both parties presented their positions in court and the defendant filed a counterclaim seeking compensation for the sale of another property the court adjourned the hearing and requested further evidence the plaintiff submitted a certificate to confirm the loan balance but the defendant argues that it is void the court found the plaintiffs claim partially admissible and the defendants counterclaim admissible the court partially satisfied the plaintiffs claim and dismissed the counterclaim the court also ruled on the ownership of an apartment property determining that it should be considered joint property the judgment was made in accordance with specific articles of the civil code
